TextView.android:text: We can agree that 70% of energy in your home is consumed in the kitchen. We are here to make what seems impossible possible with our energy-saving tips. Ensure you fill your kettle with adequate water rather than overfilling. This move saves the energy you would use to heat the extra unneeded water. Additionally, consider filling your dishwasher adequately rather than washing a few utensils at a time. With this move, you will realize a reduction in electricity bills and water consumption. Saving energy in the kitchen also goes for your microwave and cooker. Ensure you use these appliances efficiently without leaving them on the run for too long. Alternatively, gas cookers can be used for cooking or warming food.
